citeinfo.title: QUARRIES_ABANDONED_IN: Abandoned Quarries in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: This shapefile was derived from information from the following CD-ROM publication: Hasenmueller, W.A., and Ault, C.H., 2001, Abandoned Industrial Minerals Quarries in Indiana, 2nd Edition, Digital Version, Computer Database 2, Indiana Geological Survey.

citeinfo.title: Abandoned Industrial Minerals Quarries in Indiana, 2nd Edition, Digital Version, Computer Database 2

descript.abstract: QUARRIES_ABANDONED_IN was derived from a comma-delimited text file named "QUALOC.TXT" contained on the following CD-ROM publication: Hasenmueller, W.A., and Ault, C.H., 2001, Abandoned Industrial Minerals Quarries in Indiana, 2nd Edition, Digital Version, Computer Database 2, Indiana Geological Survey. The field named "QUANUM" can be used to link this data to the following tables available in the publication cited above: bibliography (QUAREF.TXT), history of operation (QUAHIS.TXT), and stratigraphy (QUASTR.TXT). It contains all abandoned quarry locations within QUALOC.TXT that have locational information that is adequate to determine UTM coordinate values.
descript.purpose: QUARRIES_ABANDONED_IN was created to provide a digital coverage of abandoned industrial minerals quarries in Indiana, suitable for use in a GIS.

idinfo.native: ArcView version 3.3 shapefile format, approximately 224 Kb, Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.1 (Build 2600), ESRI ArcCatalog 8.2.0.700

attracc.attraccr: The quarry sites included in this coverage were identified by IGS field geologists or taken from literature sources judged to be reliable by IGS geologists.

dataqual.logic: Duplicate features may exist in this data set. Quarries which are abandoned and reopened under a new name may be represented more than once in the data set.
dataqual.complete: There are 1,134 quarries listed in the original QUALOC.TXT file. QUARRIES_ABANDONED_IN contains 1,071 of those quarries. Quarries were omitted from the data set where the section was not given in QUALOC.TXT, or where there was uncertainty regarding the locational information contained in QUALOC.TXT. In addition, one quarry was located in a nonexistent section and that quarry was dropped from this data set.

horizpa.horizpar: Most of the quarry location coordinates were obtained using Geographix Software and a land grid developed by White Star, Inc. (Denver, CO). The locations will be no more precise than the 3rd quarter section, or the number of quarter sections in the field named "Qtr." Locations with no quarter sections, or those located in the noncongressional locations such as reserves, donations, and the Clark Military Grants were located by hand in approximately the correct locations.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

srcinfo.srccitea: Hasenmueller, W.A., and Ault, C.H., 2001, Abandoned Industrial Minerals Quarries in Indiana, 2nd Edition, Digital Version, Computer Database 2, Indiana Geological Survey.
srcinfo.srccontr: Quarry name, locational information, and selected mining data were extracted from QUALOC.TXT.

procstep.procdesc: The file QUALOC.TXT was imported into Microsoft Access. Locations from this file were modified to create up to three quarter sections that best described the location. These modifications are contained in the field named "Loc_qtr." A text file was then created with locations using the Congressional Land Survey System (section, township, and range), and this text file was processed with GES97 software, GeoGraphix, Inc., using a land grid created by White Star, Inc. to obtain coordinate locations in UTM Zone 16 NAD27. The text file was then imported to an ArcInfo coverage and the coordinates were then converted to UTM Zone 16 NAD83 using ESRI ArcMap 8.3. The coverage was exported as a text file and joined to the original data in Microsoft Access. The text file named "QUARRIES.TXT" was exported which combined the original data and the UTM coordinate locations.
QUARRIES.TXT was added as a table into ESRI ArcView 3.3, and the "Add Event Theme" function was used to convert the table to QUARRIES_ABANDONED_IN.SHP.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."
